title: I’m currently writing a fantasy book. How do I start building my world around my characters using show not tell? - Quora

response.answer_text: You show your character(s) interacting with the world, which to them is the place where they normally live and operate. They don’t explain it, nor does the narrator, just as you wouldn’t explain how a light switch works or what makes an automobile go. My fantasy novel, A God in Chains, is set in a world of wizards and walled cities. I don’t explain any of that; I just show it. See the opening: Curious Fictions: A God in Chains (excerpt) by Matthew Hughes
